channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy after tumultuous period in which two attempted mergers fell through

item.title: Bernard Arnault’s son to take up new job leading LVMH’s struggling drinks division
item.description: Tiffany & Co executive Alexandre Arnault, 32, will take up a new position as Deputy CEO of LVMH’s wine & spirits division in February 2025

item.title: Nasdaq Futures Gain in Early Trading
item.description: Stock futures tied to the Nasdaq-100 and the S&P 500 edged up, while Dow industrials futures slipped.

item.title: ‘I handle my dad’s finances’: My father is in a nursing home and will get $100K in compensation. What should I do with it?
item.description: “I’ve thought about CDs, money-market and mutual funds.”

item.title: Morgan Stanley finally turns bullish on U.S. stocks as it says the S&P 500 could jump as high as 7,400
item.description: Better late than never? Morgan Stanley says it’s now overweight U.S. stocks.
